page.title: 13St.MARY'S STREET,CHIPPENHAM.
page.content: Behind{Saint Andrew's Church}on its eastern side lies{Saint Mary's Street. It is the oldest street in Chippenham.Many of the houses were built in the 17th century,although one house,Wood House,was built in the 16th century. Today{Saint Mary's Street}is a quiet unspoilt street away from the bustle of the town.In the 18th century it was called{Cook Street}and it was here in 1773 that the first school in Chippenham opened for fifteen poor boys.In the garden of the Old Vicarage in 1694 the local Member of Parliament for Chippenham,Roger Holland,claimed that the water from the well had medicinal properties and tried to establish Chippenham as a spa town but failed.Today the Old Vicarage is the headquarters of the Chippenham Society of the Arts.
